Class LocalContextExecutionControl

java.lang.Object
jdk.jshell.execution.DirectExecutionControl
jdk.jshell.execution.LocalExecutionControl
org.dellroad.javabox.execution.LocalContextExecutionControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, ExecutionControl
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavaBoxExecutionControl
public class LocalContextExecutionControl extends LocalExecutionControl
A LocalExecutionControl that provides the ability to add thread-local context to the execution of each JShell snippet and its subsequent result decoding into a String.

It is sometimes useful to have the execution of JShell snippets occur within some thread-local context. For example, a database application might want to open a transaction around each snippet execution. This is somewhat tricky because JShell's LocalExecutionControl executes snippets in a different thread from the main command loop thread so, for example, using clientCodeEnter() and clientCodeLeave() won't work.

In addition, the context may also be necessary during the conversion of the snippet result into a String for display in the JShell console. This conversion is performed by DirectExecutionControl.valueString(java.lang.Object) and is normally done later, in a separate thread. This class performs this conversion earlier, in the same thread that executes the snippet, while the context is still available.

The methods a subclass can use to bracket snippet execution and String result decoding are enterContext() and leaveContext(); the latter method also provides access the actual snippet return value, rather than just its String representation.

      Constructor.

  • Method Details

    • invoke

      protected String invoke(Method method) throws Exception
      Overrides:
      invoke in class LocalExecutionControl
      Throws:
      Exception

    • enterContext

      protected void enterContext()
      Enter a new thread-local context for snippet execution.

      The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl does nothing.

    • leaveContext

      protected void leaveContext(Object returnValue, Throwable error)
      Leave the thread-local context previously opened by enterContext() in the current thread.

      The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl does nothing.

      Parameters:
      returnValue - the return value from the successful execution of an expression snippet, otherwise null
      error - the exception thrown by snippet execution if there was an error, otherwise null

    • invokeWithContext

      protected Object invokeWithContext(Method method) throws Throwable
      Execute the given snippet in context.

      The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl uses enterContext() and leaveContext() to bracket the execution of the snippet and the decoding of its result (via valueStringWithContext()). The decoded result is wrapped in a StringWrapper to prevent duplicate decoding by JShell.

      Parameters:
      method - static snippet method
      Returns:
      result from snippet execution
      Throws:
      Throwable

    • valueStringWithContext

      protected String valueStringWithContext(Object result)
      Decode the snippet result into a String for display in the JShell console.

      The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl just invokes DirectExecutionControl.valueString(java.lang.Object).

    • invokeWrapper

      public static Object invokeWrapper() throws Throwable
      Invocation wrapper method.

      This method recovers the current instance and the actual method to invoke from CURRENT_INVOCATION and then delegates to invokeWithContext().

      This method is only used internally but is required to be public due to Java access controls.

      Returns:
      result from snippet execution
      Throws:
      Throwable
